headline: Is Weyerhaeuser’s 28% Slide in 2025 Creating a Mispriced Timberland Opportunity?
summary: Whether you are wondering if Weyerhaeuser is a quietly mispriced way to gain exposure to timber and real estate, or a value trap in disguise, this article will walk you through what the numbers are really saying about the stock today. Despite its strong asset base, the share price has slid, with Weyerhaeuser down roughly 2.3% over the last week, 3.5% over the past month, and 22.5% year to date, compounding to a 28.4% drop over the last year. Recent moves have come against a backdrop of...

headline: Weyerhaeuser (WY): Taking a Fresh Look at Valuation After a Steep Year‑to‑Date Share Price Decline
summary: Weyerhaeuser (WY) has quietly slipped this year, with the stock down about 22% year to date, even as its timber and real estate operations continue generating steady cash flow and improving earnings. See our latest analysis for Weyerhaeuser. The recent slide has left Weyerhaeuser’s share price at $21.69, with a 90 day share price return of negative 17.1%, and a one year total shareholder return of negative 28.4%, pointing to fading momentum despite healthier earnings and modest top line...
